 Four ships from the Fred Olsen fleet meet in Bergen, Norway. Picture: supplied Source: Supplied
NORWAY CALLING
THE many Australians who have sailed with UK-based Fred Olsen Line will be interested in a first for the company, the “4 Bs in Bergen” event when the line’s four ships converged in the one place for the first time. The Balmoral, Braemar, Boudicca and Black Watch carrying 4000 guests met in Bergen, Norway, while each was on a fjords cruise. Fifth and sixth-generation family members Fred Olsen and Fred Olsen Jnr were among guests. The Fred Olsen Company originated in the village of Hvitsten, outside Oslo, in 1848 when three Olsen brothers – Fredrik, Petter and Andreas – bought their first ships. The line offers regular cruises from Britain to Norway among its itineraries, and Black Watch will visit Australia in the coming summer cruise season.
Ph 1300 669 369 or see cruiseabroad.com.au
PACIFIC ODYSSEY
CROSS the Pacific Ocean on a well-priced repositioning cruise. A cruise from Vancouver to Sydney on Holland America Line’s MS Volendam is priced from $3099 a person, twin-share, for the 25-night itinerary, or about $120 a day inclusive of all meals and entertainment. The cruise visits Seattle, Honolulu, Pago Pago, Suva, Lautoka, Mystery Island, Lifou, Isle of Pines and Noumea before arriving in Sydney. Valid for sale until August 31, 2015, for travel commencing September 23, 2015.
Ph 1300 450 133 or see cruiseabout.com.au
SAIL EUROPE’S RIVERS
LUXURY cruise line Crystal Cruises’ offshoot Crystal River Cruises will launch two river yacht vessels in Europe starting in March 2017. Itineraries, fares and bookings for the 70-suite ships will be available from December. Crystal plans to dedicate a portion of each cruise to sailing in daylight hours, to take advantage of the changing scenery and then spend time in various ports to enjoy night-life including culinary experiences at Michelin-starred restaurants and local eateries, and exclusive evening events.
Ph 1800 251 174 or see crystalcruises.com
 Royal Caribbean International is offering summer discounts on ships including Voyager of the Seas. Picture: supplied Source: Supplied
SUMMER DEALS
SAVE up to 30 per cent on more than 150 cruises with Royal Caribbean International. Prices start from $699 a person for summer cruises in Australia, New Zealand, South Pacific and Asia on a sale ending September 16, 2015. A seven-night round trip departing Sydney on November 28, 2015, aboard Voyager of the Seas to Tasmania via Melbourne is priced from $699 a person, twin share; an eight-night round trip South Pacific cruise departing Brisbane on February 18, 2016 aboard Legend of the Seas is priced from $899 a person, twin-share; an eight-night round trip South Pacific cruise departing Sydney on January 31, 2016, aboard Radiance of the Seas is priced from $899 a person, twin share; or celebrate Valentine’s Day on Explorer of the Seas when it departs Sydney on a 10-night South Pacific sailing on February 14, 2016, priced from $999.
Ph 1800 754 500 or see royalcaribbean.com.au
DANUBE DEBUT
WALTZ down the Danube on the new Monarch Empress after it enters service next year on a 12-night package priced from $2749 a person, twin share, valid until September 4. The trip includes a seven-night cruise from Budapest to Regensburg, two nights in Budapest and three nights in Prague. Departures are on June 30, July 28 and August 11.
Ph 1300 653 618 or see gate1travel.com.au
